label: Intro
value: Here is a step-by-step guide for what happens when visiting St John's Park Church on a Sunday.

label: Step label prefix
value: Step

label: Steps 1
value: When I arrive at St John's Park Church I will see a big blue open door with a ramp for wheelchair access.

label: Steps 2
value: I will go inside two sets of doors and then there will be someone at the back of church to say hello to me.

label: Steps 3
value: There will be ear defenders and activity bags for me to use if I want to. I am allowed to borrow them without asking.

label: Steps 4
value: The toilets are in the side hallway. There is also an accessible toilet and I am allowed to use it even if I don't have a disability.

label: Steps 5
value: In church I can sit on any of the available seats. If I have a wheelchair I am welcome to sit wherever I feel most comfortable.

label: Steps 6
value: When the service is ready to start, the person leading will say hello and tell us what is happening.

label: Steps 7
value: During the service we will sing songs. I can stand up or sit down to sing. It is OK to move around, dance or wave a flag.

label: Steps 8
value: After the Family Song, I will be invited to go into the side hall for kids activities. There is circle time, games, stories and a craft. It is OK to stay in the main service.

label: Steps 9
value: After the service I can stay for a drink and a biscuit and talk to people. If I don't want to do this, that is OK and I can go home with my family when we are ready.

label: Heading
value: Sunday Kids Groups

label: Alt
value: Children playing in the church park

label: Src
value: /images/kids-frisbee.jpg

label: Paragraphs 1
value: Our Park Kids groups are for children aged 1-11 and run during our Sunday gathering at 10:45am.

label: Paragraphs 2
value: Children start in the service with the church family and then move into age-appropriate groups for Bible teaching, prayer, and activities.

label: Title
value: Park Kids
